As of 24 November, the Slovak Republic is part of “Team Europe” and has joined COVAX. Therefore, once vaccines are available it is expected that the following policy will be in place:  The Global Alliance for Vaccines and Immunizations, through the COVAX platform ensures coverage of 20% of the country's population free of charge, the following target groups have been identified: medical workers; adults over 65 years of age and comorbidities (high risk group); beneficiaries of temporary or long-term placement centers; people with comorbidities; social workers; workers in the field of education and those in security bodies.  Subsequently, depending on the availability of the vaccine, other groups of the population will be vaccinated, which are equally extremely important.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201213220911/https://www.gavi.org/sites/default/files/covid/pr/COVAX_CA_COIP_List_COVAX_PR_24-11.pdf
No change found.

A:    On 26 December, the first person received a vaccine and roll-out out 4 additional hospitals was scheduled to begin 27 December. Four waves of vaccination are planned:  1. healthcare staff, employees of nursing homes, critical infrastructure;  2. people older than 65 years, people suffering from chronic diseases, clients of nursing homes;  3. marginalised groups, homeless people, asylum seekers, teachers;  4. everybody older than 18 years (voluntary principle).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210102214442/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22562138/vaccines-have-arrived.html

A:    No policy changes, workers in health care / social services are eligible to sign-up for vaccination currently.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210109223845/https://www.uvzsr.sk/index.php?option=com_content&view=frontpage&Itemid=1  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109224013/https://korona.gov.sk/tlacove-spravy/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210109220424/https://sk.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Update immunization policy is in place from 18 January – currently health care professionals and other workers in health care facilities are eligible + newly also old people in nursing homes. People from critical infrastructure will be moved to the list of replacements, meaning they will receive the vaccination only if there is unused vaccine or someone fails to attend.    In the second phase:  residents of senior's homes and people over 65, patients with serious diagnoses, such as diabetes, oncological diseases, auto-immune diseases, cardiovascular issues and other chronic diseases     In the third phase: people in communities with a high risk of fast coronavirus spread like teachers, people living in marginalised Roma communities, homeless people and asylum seekers    In the fourth phase: members of the general public older than 18     https://web.archive.org/web/20210118213749/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22574807/vaccination-strategy-to-change.html

A,C:    Pfizer/BioNTech, Moderna    As of 05 February, it was expected to add AstraZeneca in the following week. In addition, the Health Ministry is considering ordering the Russian-made Sputnik V vaccine.     https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22590217/news-digest-british-variant-widespread-across-the-country.html  https://web.archive.org/web/20210206212305/https://spectator.sme.sk/c/22589821/should-people-be-able-to-choose-their-vaccine-its-better-not-to-say-experts-and-ministry.html?ref=av-center

Another group to be vaccinated are people suffering from serious diseases, regardless of their age, as well as carers and people entitled to care benefits. Registration for COVID-19 vaccination is open to anyone from the age of 12 with public health insurance in Slovakia. Foreigners living in Slovakia who do not have public health insurance granted by one of the three health insurers in Slovakia can now register for vaccination against Covid-19.  The Health Ministry has expanded the group of people who can now register for vaccination: 1) People who do not have Slovak public health insurance but have a residence permit (tolerated, registered, temporary, long-term, permanent residence) in Slovakia: 2) Full-time university students in Slovakia without Slovak public health insurance: 3) Primary/secondary school pupils in Slovakia without Slovak public health insurance: 4) Asylum seekers in Slovakia whose application has not been decided on yet.     https://archive.vn/2Kzj1    https://archive.vn/P32m7   https://archive.vn/xoQva   https://archive.vn/h2etS

Pfizer/BionTech & Moderna & AstraZeneca vaccines     The vaccination of people older than 80 continues throughout the country today, including in Ljubljana and Ajdovšcina.    Vaccination is free for all citizens, regardless of whether they are insured or not. Funds for the purchase of vaccines and costs for vaccination are provided in the budget of the Republic of Slovenia.    5 Feb -  Slovenia started vaccinating the elderly in care homes first, as care homes recorded frequent outbreaks and suffered the most fatalities. Apart from the elderly, nursing home and hospital staff are also being vaccinated in Slovenia at the moment.    The country has also recently received the first batch of a vaccine developed by AstraZeneca, which is, however, recommended for a younger population. Following vaccines are administered: Astra-Zenica, Moderna, and Pfizer-BioNTech.   Vaccination is free of charge and provided to all who have permanent or temporary residence in the Republic of Slovenia and not only for citizens of the Republic of Slovenia, regardless of whether they are insured.     https://archive.fo/y4aJ1

Available for everyone.   Per Slovenian government announcement, vaccination administration began with health care workers, critical infrastructure workers, and vulnerable populations. For the general population, Slovenia is currently vaccinating those age 60+.  According to the announcement, vaccines are available to all residents of Slovenia (but not visitors), regardless of insurance status. Following vaccines are administered: Astra-Zenica, Moderna, and Pfizer-BioNTech.   Vaccination is free of charge and provided to all who have permanent or temporary residence in the Republic of Slovenia and not only for citizens of the Republic of Slovenia, regardless of whether they are insured.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210117152743/https://www.gov.si/en/news/?cat%5B0%5D=1&tag%5B0%5D=554  http://web.archive.org/web/20210521092205/https://www.gov.si/teme/koronavirus-sars-cov-2/cepljenje-proti-covid-19/

By the end of May, Slovenia had received 1,309,275 vaccine doses. Most people have been vaccinated with the Pfizer/Biotech vaccine, followed by AstraZeneca, Moderna and Janssen, which started arriving in April. Groups: A, B, C.   Increased vaccine supply has accelerated the vaccination of the population. By 2 June 2021, 20.5 per cent of the population had been vaccinated, compared to 10.2 per cent by 1 May 2021. By the end of June, Slovenia should therefore reach the target of 60-per cent vaccination coverage of the entire population.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210607200609/https://www.gov.si/en/news/2021-06-03-the-zvem-web-portal-as-main-access-point-to-acquire-a-digital-covid-certificate/

***Recoded from 3G to 2G. Not all areas are vaccinating all three groups. Since this indicator is coded to the lowest national standard (rather than the highest targeted measure) 2G better reflects the national baseline for vaccination.     See previous coding note:     A,B,C:  Almost all regions are now in phase 2, a few still in phase 1, and Kalmar is the first region to have entered phase 3.     Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them.  Several regions have entered Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups (B): adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy.  Phase 3 in Kalmar initially means everyone over 60, and later will also include over-18s who have certain underlying health conditions, including chronic heart, lung, liver or kidney disease, severe asthma, diabetes, health conditions that cause impaired lung functioning (for example extreme obesity, neuromuscular diseases or multiple disabilities), Down syndrome, or people with a severely weakened immune system due to illness or ongoing medical treatment.     Information on phases:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419192822/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn     Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions:   - http://web.archive.org/web/20210419200401/https://www.thelocal.se/20210414/where-is-the-vaccination-programme-up-to-in-swedens-21-regions/  - http://web.archive.org/web/20210419194247/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset  - Kalmar press release: http://web.archive.org/web/20210419200726/https://www.regionkalmar.se/nyhetslista/60-64-aringar-kan-boka-vaccination/     Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca  - From 25 March, the use of AstraZeneca was continued for people over 65, but remained suspended for younger people: http://web.archive.org/web/20210326104151/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/mars/vaccinationerna-med-astra-zenecas-vaccin-kan-fortsatta-for-personer-som-ar-65-ar-och-aldre/  - Re Janssen: The American manufacturer has suspended deliveries of Janssen's vaccine to Europe. To date, 31,000 doses have arrived in Sweden, but none have been distributed for vaccination. The Swedish Public Health Agency is now awaiting the results of the EMA's ongoing safety investigation. Until then, the recommendation is not to use the vaccine doses: http://web.archive.org/web/20210419193234/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/janssens-vaccin-pausas-i-vantan-pa-utredning-fran-ema/     Vaccinations are still taking place:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210419192826/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

**Updated to clarify that this should not be a 4 code (which is why it was flagged) as this variable is coded according to the lowest common value if there is geographic variation, and only a few regions have the vaccine available to a broad group.**    Original note:    A,B,C:  Many regions are in phase 3, and a few areas have advanced to phase 4 for people over 55 years old. "Stockholm is the first big city region to start Phase 4, after Kalmar, Jönköping and Värmland began it earlier this week. In Västra Götaland, some individual centres have opened up vaccination to under-60s, with Skåne saying it aims to offer the vaccine to all adults from mid-June onwards."  http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150720/https://www.thelocal.se/20210506/stockholm-starts-phase-4-of-covid-19-vaccinations/    Information on phases:   Phase 1: The first group to be offered vaccination will be those living in nursing homes or receiving home care, members of the same household and staff who work with them.  Several regions have entered Phase 2, which includes anyone 65+ (though implementation differs from region to region) as well as a few clinically vulnerable groups (B): adults receiving LSS interventions or assistance allowance, healthcare and care service personnel, people who have undergone bone marrow or other organ transplantation and people undergoing dialysis treatment. Information on which groups are included the different phases of the vaccination strategy.  Phase 3 initially means everyone over 60, and later will also include over-18s who have certain underlying health conditions, including chronic heart, lung, liver or kidney disease, severe asthma, diabetes, health conditions that cause impaired lung functioning (for example extreme obesity, neuromuscular diseases or multiple disabilities), Down syndrome, or people with a severely weakened immune system due to illness or ongoing medical treatment.  In Phase 4, all adults will be offered the vaccine, but it will still be offered in a staggered way, opened up to five-year age groups at a time.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150708/https://www.krisinformation.se/en/hazards-and-risks/disasters-and-incidents/2020/official-information-on-the-new-coronavirus/vaccination-against-covid-19/when-is-it-my-turn    The Public Health Agency has clarified that in each of these phases, the oldest people should be vaccinated first. Healthcare professionals that receive priority are those at great risk of infecting patients, i.e. those in daily or prolonged contact with patients in a risk group: http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150756/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/fortydligande-om-vaccination-av-medarbetare-i-halso--och-sjukvard/     Information on stages of vaccination campaign in different regions:   http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150606/https://www.krisinformation.se/detta-kan-handa/handelser-och-storningar/20192/myndigheterna-om-det-nya-coronaviruset/regional-information-om-coronaviruset     Type of vaccine: Pfizer, Moderna, AstraZeneca  - The use of the Janssen vaccin is suspended for all age groups. "The vaccine is not recommended for people under 65, and those over 65 will have received other vaccines before Janssen's vaccine can be delivered."  http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150759/https://www.krisinformation.se/nyheter/20212/april2/fortsatt-paus-for-janssens-vaccin    - The recommendation to only use AstraZeneca for people over 65 remains: http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150801/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/rekommendation-om-aldersgrans-pa-65-ar-for-astrazenecas-vaccin-kvarstar/  But anyone under the age of 65 who has already received a first dose of Astra Zeneca's vaccine can also receive their second dose of the same vaccine if they specifically request it. The recommendation to offer the mRNA vaccine as a second dose still applies. http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150836/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/nyheter-och-press/nyhetsarkiv/2021/april/tillatet-att-valja-astra-zeneca-for-de-yngre-som-tidigare-fatt-en-forsta-dos/    - Details on delivery of the 3 vaccines in use: http://web.archive.org/web/20210507150823/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/leveranser-av-vaccin/    Vaccinations are still taking place:  http://web.archive.org/web/20210506233027/https://www.folkhalsomyndigheten.se/smittskydd-beredskap/utbrott/aktuella-utbrott/covid-19/statistik-och-analyser/statistik-over-registrerade-vaccinationer-covid-19/

A,B,C:  All regions are in Phase 3 and more and more regions are starting the final Phase 4, however, as this is coded according to the lowest common value if there is geographic variation, it is still coded as 3.     Regions currently in Phase 4: Blekinge (currently open for people born 1957-1981 and people in risk groups 40-59 år); Dalarna, Gävleborg (open to people born 1971 and earlier and people aged 18-59 in risk groups), Halland (1972 or earlier + 18-59 risk group), Jämtland (anyone over 40), Jönköping (anyone over 55, 18-59 risk group), Kalmar (anyone over 50, 18-59 risk group), Kronoberg (anyone over 55), Norrbotten (1971 or earlier), Skåne (anyone over 50 or in risk group), Stockholm (1976 or earlier), Sörmland (1971 or earlier + adults in risk group), Uppsala (1971 or earlier + 18-49 risk group), Värmland (1971 or earlier + adults in risk group), Västmanland (1971 or earlier + adults in risk group), Västra Götaland (1971 or earlier + adults in risk group), Örebro (1966 or earlier + adults in risk group), Östergötland (1966 or earlier + adults in risk group).    Not yet in Phase 4: Gotland (open for people born 1961 and earlier), Västerbotten (anyone over 60 + adults in risk group), Västernorrland (anyone over 60, 18-59 risk group). Eswatini continues to prepare for the arrival and receipt of vaccine doses. The Ministry of Health released a Press Statement (viewed on Twitter), which recognized that the African Union was successful in securing a provisional 270 Million doses of vaccines from various suppliers. Additionally, Eswatini has been allocated vaccines through the COVAX Facility, however vaccines are expected to be received around March 2021.     http://web.archive.org/web/20210201123052/https://twitter.com/EswatiniGovern1/status/1355921031379218434

Has the government of Eswatini approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? No.  The United States Government does not plan to provide COVID-19 vaccinations to private U.S. citizens overseas. Please follow host country developments and guidelines for COVID-19 vaccination.  https://web.archive.org/web/2021022200.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/
No evidence of de facto availability.

Eswatini has joined the COVAX Facility through which the country will secure vaccine doses to cover 20 percent of the population, of which 108,000 doses of AstraZeneca vaccine are expected in early March, and the remaining balance will arrive in 2021Q2. Government has further ordered 2 million doses from the Serum Institute of India and 237,328 doses from the AU, both expected to arrive in 2021Q2. The Eswatini National Immunization Technical Advisory Group (ESWANITAG) was appointed to provide scientific recommendations during the introduction of new vaccines and the implementation of immunization strategies.  In FY21/22 the government has budgeted E200 million to procure vaccines for Eswatini's entire population.   https://web.archive.org/web/20210322074813/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

Rollout of COVID vaccination campaign. Currently in phase 1 of the programme, targeting frontline health workers (group A). The vaccine administered is AstraZeneca.     See a new report from the WHO, Eswatini:   https://web.archive.org/web/20210406111502/https://www.afro.who.int/news/eswatini-launches-nationwide-covid-19-vaccination-campaign

According to the APM Statement of 23 April, health workers, the elderly and people with co-morbidities have taken the COVID-19 vaccine jab over the past few weeks. Phase 1 of the vaccination exercise using the first batch of the AstraZeneca vaccine has been high paced and very successful. https://web.archive.org/web/20210426132544/http://www.gov.sz/images/APM-Statement-23-April-2021.pdf

No change in vaccination policy. The expected shipment of 500,000 doses of AstraZeneca vaccine were delayed and are expected to be arriving in about two weeks from May 27, 2021. Negotiations ongoing regarding Pfizer, J&J, Moderna and Sputnik V vaccines.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210529060118/http://www.gov.sz/images/CORONA/Health-Statement-Vaccines-update-27-May-2021.pdf    https://web.archive.org/web/20210528222807/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

AstraZeneca  Eswatini received 32,000 AstraZeneca vaccine doses in mid-March through the COVAX Facility (12,000 doses) and the Serum Institute of India (SII) (20,000 doses) donated by the Government of India. The COVID-19 vaccination campaign was launched on March 19, 2021, with vaccines administered to essential workers and leading politicians, before expanding it to include the general elderly population starting on March 30, 2021. The next COVAX delivery of AstraZeneca vaccines and a 500,000-dose donation from Oxford University/AstraZeneca are expected in mid-June 2021.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210608073025/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19

President Wavel Ramkalawan announced  that Seychelles will receive 350,000 COVID-19 vaccines through three different donations. The President said he hopes that the vaccination program will begin in the island nation in January. Ramkalawan said that 100,000 Moderna vaccines developed by the United States will be donated by an anonymous investor. There is a second investor who is ready to give 200,000 vaccines and thirdly Abu Dhabi is ready to give Seychelles 50,000 vaccines immediately.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201222051502/http://www.seychellesnewsagency.com/articles/14051/Seychelles+to+receive+%2C+COVID+vaccines%3B+campaign+could+begin+in+January
A: Sinopharm and Moderna  http://web.archive.org/web/20210125143509/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/2021/01/08/ministry-of-health-to-begin-covid-19-vaccination-campaign/

A:   Seychelles initiated its COVID-19 vaccination campaign with the China manufactured vaccine, Sinopharm on Sunday 10th January 2021. Healthcare workers, executive leaders and workers in essential services were the first groups to receive the vaccine. Vaccination is ongoing continue with workers in essential services and later be rolled out for other groups in the population.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210201214941/http://www.health.gov.sc/index.php/covid-19-vaccination-faqs/

A: healthcare workers.  Oxford/Astrazeneca    Dushanbe, Tajikistan, 09 March 2021 – Today Tajikistan received via the COVAX Facility, 192,000 doses of the AstraZeneca/Oxford COVID-19 vaccine. This is the first shipment of COVID-19 vaccines from the COVAX Facility to arrive in Central Asia and the second such shipment to the WHO European Region.  http://web.archive.org/web/20210316210247/https://www.unicef.org/tajikistan/press-releases/tajikistan-becomes-first-country-central-asia-receive-covid-19-vaccine-through-0

Plans for vaccination campaigns have been announced and doses have been received by Tajikistan but are only supposed to begin in mid-2021.    ______________________________________  Quote from article 1:  "Dushanbe, Tajikistan, 09 March 2021 – Today Tajikistan received via the COVAX Facility, 192,000 doses of the AstraZeneca/Oxford COVID-19 vaccine."    Archived link 1:  http://archive.today/2021.03.22-134037/https://www.unicef.org/tajikistan/press-releases/tajikistan-becomes-first-country-central-asia-receive-covid-19-vaccine-through-0    ______________________________________  Quote from article 2:  "The COVID-19 vaccines will be provided through the Gavi-COVAX Advanced Market Commitment Global Financing Mechanism (for about 16 percent of the population) and through this project (4 percent). The procurement and delivery of vaccines will be undertaken by UNICEF. The Ministry of Health and Social Protection of the Population of Tajikistan (MoHSP) has identified the segments of the populations that will be included in the first stage of the vaccination program, including health and social care workers, the population over 50 years of age, people with underlying health conditions, as well as teachers and employees of educational institutions.    The exact number of people to be vaccinated under this additional financing and in collaboration with COVAX, will depend on final vaccine prices negotiated between COVAX and manufacturers."    Archived link 2:  http://archive.today/2021.03.22-134057/https://www.worldbank.org/en/news/press-release/2021/02/11/world-bank-supports-covid-19-vaccine-rollout-in-tajikistan    ____________________________________    Quote from article 3:  "the Minister of Health said that the distribution of the first vaccines would begin by mid-2021.    According to him, following the instructions of the COVAX mechanism, first, it is necessary to ensure the vaccination of:    The healthcare and social workers who are at a high risk of infection,  The elderly and persons suffering from chronic non-contagious diseases, such as cardiovascular diseases, diabetes, diseases associated with metabolic disorders, or have a high risk of death.  The target group from the population to be vaccinated against COVID-19 is already determined: it is 1.8 million people or 20% of the population of Tajikistan. This group includes healthcare and education workers, persons over 50 and persons with chronic non-contagious diseases.    The vaccination will be voluntary and free of charge. After the vaccine is delivered to Tajikistan, the Ministry of Health of the country will announce the locations and the process of registering for vaccination."    Archived link 3:  http://archive.today/2021.03.22-134842/https://www.intellinews.com/tajikistan-receives-first-batch-of-covid-19-vaccines-205134/

Interest in joining the COVAX programme has been stated by the government of Turkmenistan but no actual vaccination campaigns seen being done yet.    Chinese made vaccines have arrived in Turkmenistan, and the Russian vaccine has been registered in the country as well, however, there is no stated policy (at this current point in time) to dictate how the vaccines will be used.    There is one article found that the government of Turkmenistan intends to vaccinate foreign athletes competing in the tennis' Davis Cup and the Track Cycling World Championships in October. all of which for free.    _______________________________________  Quote from article 1:  "Turkmenistan plans to vaccinate foreign athletes competing in the isolated Central Asian state, one of the few countries in the world yet to declare a coronavirus case, state media said on Thursday (Jan 21).  The former Soviet state is set to hold qualifying events for tennis' Davis Cup and will host the Track Cycling World Championships in October."    "we must provide this vaccination for free"    "Mr Berdymukhamedov has said the Turkmen government is in talks with other companies over importing their vaccines." Has the government of Timor-Leste approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? Yes.  The government has approved a vaccination plan for the use of the AstraZeneca vaccine.  Vaccinations are voluntary and will be implemented in three phases with the majority of individuals vaccinated in the third phase.  As of the time of this update, the government has not commenced vaccinations.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210329154910/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

Has the government of Timor-Leste approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use?  Yes.  Timor-Leste uses the AstraZeneca vaccine, and its vaccination program commenced on April 7. The aim of the Timorese authorities is to start the vaccination programme, firstly for front line workers, on April 07, which marks World Health Day.  A- Key workers    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210410135422/https://covid19.gov.tl/en/first-vaccines-for-east-timor-arrive-in-dili-on-monday-lusa/  https://web.archive.org/web/20210410135453/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/

The vaccination plan starts in april 7. The vaccine will be administered phased to priority groups until the eligible population is fully vaccinated, and the criteria for access to vaccination are equitable within the same need/benefit group of the vaccine. In the first phase, 8% of the population is expected to be vaccinated, of which 3% correspond to frontline workers, including employees working in Quarantine and Isolation Units, or at the Entry Stations (airport, port and land border). The remaining 5% of this first phase covers the population residing in the area near the land border and people with, at least, one of the pathologies considered of risk.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210526214836/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?p=26919&lang=en&n=1

The Timor Leste is currently in phase 2 of vaccination programme, giving vaccines to elderly (>60years old) and people with comorbidities. It's government funded.   http://web.archive.org/web/20210604174724/https://covid19.gov.tl/wp-content/uploads/2021/05/Vaccination-Schedule_Dili-Phase-2_Dr-Nahar.pdf

According to the vaccination plan, in the Municipality of Dili, the first dose will continue to be administered to the population that has not yet received vaccination, with the Sinovac and AstraZeneca vaccines. With the arrival of the vaccines from the COVAX mechanism, second doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine will begin to be distributed throughout the country to the population vaccinated in the first phase. The first doses will also continue to be distributed in the remaining municipalities, with priority being given to citizens over 60 years old or with comorbidities.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174635/https://tl.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174640/http://timor-leste.gov.tl/?cat=10&lang=en  http://web.archive.org/web/20210616174701/https://tl.usembassy.gov/health-alert-u-s-embassy-dili-timor-leste-june-2-2021/

Wednesday, July 22, 2020 - 21:17  The Pacific region, including Tonga, is requesting access to a vaccine currently being developed to fight COVID-19, said the Minister for Health Hon ‘Amelia Tu’ipulotu today. They are talking to the World Health Organisation and taking part in preliminary discussions with the COVID-19 Vaccine Global Access (COVAX) Facility and GAVI, the Vaccine Alliance. It is hoped that by the end of 2021 there will be enough vaccine to immunise 20% of the population, starting with front line workers.    http://archive.today/2020.12.18-124633/https://matangitonga.to/2020/07/22/pacific-access-vaccine

"Tonga wants to join COVAX to access CoViD-19 vaccines Wednesday, August 26, 2020 - 19:44 Tonga has provided an Expression of Interest to join COVAX to access CoViD-19 vaccines confirmed the Ministry of Health CEO, Dr Siale ‘Akau’ola. It will give early access to vaccinations for the most vulnerable people in member countries populations."  http://archive.today/2020.12.18-130554/https://matangitonga.to/2020/08/26/tonga-wants-join-covax-access-covid-19-vaccines

"Covid-19 vaccine roll out starts in parts of the Pacific"    Vaccinations reported to be commencing in the US territory of the Northern Mariana Islands, but it remains unclear when other countries in the region will access vaccines.    "New Zealand now has agreements in place to secure enough vaccines to vaccinate everyone in the country, as well as everyone in Samoa, Tonga, Tuvalu, Tokelau, Niue, and the Cook Islands, if the governments of those countries accept the offer."      "Tonga working through WHO plan  Tongan Ministry of Health chief executive Dr Siale 'Akauola said the country had been working with development partners "for a long time" to prepare for the vaccines.  The kingdom had also applied to COVAC for vaccines, and was awaiting a response."    Dr Akauola also questions whether it will be feasible to use the Pfizer vaccine in Tonga given the requirements for low temperture storage.    http://archive.today/2020.12.20-100600/https://www.rnz.co.nz/international/programmes/datelinepacific/audio/2018777662/covid-19-vaccine-roll-out-starts-in-parts-of-the-pacific

Currently the vaccine is unavailable but an announcement from COVAX is expected soon. The policy details (National Deployment and Vaccination Plan (NDVP)) are explained in this article.    Article notes that COVAX donates part of the vaccine and cold chain, but in order to increase coverage the countries must also contribute to the cost.  Tonga is in discussion with "development partners" to secure additional funding.    "Vaccine priority groups  Tonga’s plan is to prioritize frontline workers (those staff working/managing quarantine facilities, those required to respond to suspected cases, those working at port of entry and transporting repatriated passengers) to receive the vaccine first, followed by the elderly and those with chronic illnesses, explained Dr ‘Akau’ola.  The remaining adult population will follow. Children will be the last priority to be vaccinated."    Article notes COVAX "initial plan was to roll out CoViD-19 vaccines to frontline workers only for participant countries"    In the region, several countries have already received vaccines and are have started to implement their vaccination plans including: French Polynesia, Guam, New Caledonia, Marshall Is, American Samoa, FSM and Palau.    http://archive.today/2021.01.31-153157/https://matangitonga.to/2021/01/30/tonga-finalizing-plan-access-covid-19-vaccines

Article from Matangitonga online news:    Announcement on vaccine distribution from COVAX facility.  Refers to the distribution of vaccines in the first half of 2021 which will be followed by a further distribution later in the year.    Tonga nominally allotted 43,800 doses from AZ/SKBio manufacturing source.  However no precise date is given for when vaccines will arrive and article notes the number of doses may change.  (Context note: population of Tonga is in region of 100,000 people)    "The other 10 Pacific countries with indicative doses of AZ/SKBio are:    Fiji 100,800 doses;  Kiribati – 48,000;  Marshall Islands – 24,000;  Micronesia (Federated States of) – 48,000;  Nauru – 7,200;  New Zealand 249,600;  Samoa – 79,200;  Tonga – 43,200  Tuvalu – 4,800  Vanuatu 100,800.    The indicative distribution is intended to provide interim guidance to COVAX Facility participating countries to help their governments and public health leaders to plan and prepare for the first rounds of vaccine distribution this year, and a successful national roll out of vaccines.    “It is therefore non-binding and may be subject to change,” the forecast stated."    http://archive.today/2021.02.08-141121/https://matangitonga.to/2021/02/06/covax-facility-announces-vaccines-release-first-half-2021

TUNIS, Dec. 15 (Xinhua) -- The COVID-19 vaccines will be free for all Tunisian citizens, Hechmi Louzir, director general of the Pasteur Institute of Tunis, said on Tuesday.    Louzir told Tunis Afrique Presse that the first doses of COVID-19 vaccine will be allocated to those suffering from chronic diseases, the elderly, and health workers, adding that the vaccination will not be mandatory.    The health official affirmed that his country has already reserved 2 million doses of COVID-19 vaccines from the American pharmaceutical company Pfizer.    The Tunisian Ministry of Health has signed an agreement to obtain the above-mentioned vaccines at a price of seven U.S. dollars per dose.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210111103217/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-12/16/c_139592399.htm    https://archive.vn/wip/c9LXn

The Minister of Health stressed that the solution to controlling the epidemic in the medium term is to provide vaccination, reminding that the aim of the vaccination campaign is to reduce serious cases and deaths, maintain the capacity of the health system and protect health personnel.    According to the national strategy for mers-CoV vaccination, priority groups have been identified: citizens over 60 years of age, health professionals and vital interests, under 60 years of age with chronic diseases.        The minister stressed that the vaccines will be free, effective and high quality as it was decided to acquire vaccines from various international laboratories that have finished their research and obtained the license, announcing that pfizer laboratory obtained yesterday the license to market In Tunisia, waiting for the rest of the laboratories to obtain distribution licenses in our country in the coming weeks.    https://archive.vn/alywx

A,C: On 28 January, vaccination efforts were expanded to people at the age of 75 and above.    People are receiving CoronaVac, developed by China’s Sinovac, an inactive vaccine the country started receiving shipments of last month.    Health care workers were the first to receive the shots, and under a mass vaccination plan, the elderly citizens are next in line. The age limit will gradually drop in line with the plan.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210201020353/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/coronavirus-vaccination-in-turkey-begins-for-citizens-75-and-above/news

A,C:     On 11 February, health care workers, who were first to receive jabs last month, started receiving the second dose of CoronaVac. The inactive vaccine developed by China’s Sinovac is the only one available in the country, which plans to receive its first doses of the messenger RNA (mRNA) vaccine developed by Pfizer-BioNTech later this month.    While health care workers received their second jabs, people at the age of 70 and above are being administered their first shots.     The country's oldest citizens were vaccinated with their first jabs shortly after the first doses were administered to health care workers.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214044314/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/2nd-shot-at-hope-turkey-starts-new-round-of-covid-19-vaccines/news

A,C:    On 12 February, people at the age of 65 or above will receive their first shots.    After completing the vaccination of senior citizens, the country will move to age-independent vaccination in the next phase of the plan. These people include soldiers, police officers, teachers and people working in sectors critical for daily life, from logistics to the food sector.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210214044314/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/2nd-shot-at-hope-turkey-starts-new-round-of-covid-19-vaccines/news

A,C:     On 25 February, Health Minister Dr. Fahrettin Koca made a statement at the press conference held after the Coronavirus Scientific Committee meeting.    Minister Koca stated that 8 million doses of vaccination had been administered so far and that “We are approaching the end of the first phase in the vaccination plan."    The first phase included healthcare workers and people over age 65.     The second phase will include essential workers and people between the ages of 50 and 64.     As of 1 March, it is unclear whether the second phase has begun.    Currently, CoronaVac is the only vaccine being administered. The Health Ministry plans to diversify the vaccines by acquiring from other companies abroad, while trials continue for locally-made vaccines.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210309045419/https://covid19asi.saglik.gov.tr/    https://web.archive.org/web/20210309052425/https://www.dailysabah.com/turkey/turkey-passes-10-million-mark-in-covid-19-vaccinations/news    https://web.archive.org/web/20210309060458/https://covid19asi.saglik.gov.tr/TR-78296/asi-uygulanacak-grup-siralamasi.html

A:    Vaccines used: AstraZeneca    Taiwan’s Premier Su Tseng-chang received the AstraZeneca COVID-19 shot on Monday 22 March, having volunteered to be first in line to underscore government confidence in the vaccine’s safety as the island began its inoculation campaign. About 60,000 people are in line to get the first vaccinations and Taiwan is making sure its health workers are among the first to get it.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210328015143/https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2021/3/22/taiwan-kicks-off-covid-vaccination-campaign-with-astrazeneca-jab

The Central Epidemic Command Center of Taiwan announced in early April that COVID-19 vaccines will be 'offered to registered medical personnel, non-medical personnel at healthcare facilities, and other personnel included in the first group of vaccination program' from 6 April 2021.    https://archive.vn/Hfssu

Taiwan began to offer AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on 6 April 2021 to Group 1 people listed in the COVID-19 vaccination program, including registered medical personnel, non-medical personnel at healthcare facilities and personnel at group quarantine facilities.    https://archive.vn/Hfssu

Taiwan began to offer AstraZeneca COVID-19 vaccine on 12 APR 2021 to 'personnel at the central and local governments and front-line workers at high risk of exposure, ... include flight crews of Taiwanese airlines, crewmembers on international merchant vessels, quarantine taxi drivers, and front-line workers who deal with quarantine-related matters at quarantine hotels.'    https://archive.vn/C8dOm

From 14/04/2021, 'the government-funded COVID-19 vaccine is available to individuals in the fourth priority group, i.e., those who must travel abroad due to special circumstances such as diplomatic personnel and other personnel engaging in official business and athletes and competitors representing Taiwan overseas.'  Maintain the code because this group belongs to [A].    https://archive.vn/7kETj
No change in policy.    https://archive.vn/T1HZK

10,000 self-paid COVID-19 vaccine doses became available to the public in Taiwan on 21/04/2021. 'Related details are listed below.  1. Eligible persons: People who need to travel abroad for business, work, education, and medical treatment, and other humanitarian reasons or considerations.  2. Vaccination hospitals: A total of 31 hospitals with outpatient services in travel medicine that are designated for COVID-19 vaccination.  3. Self-paid vaccination is by appointment only.  4. The vaccine doses are distributed by the CECC to designated hospitals, and members of the public can't choose which brand of vaccine they wish to receive.  5. Members of the public who wish to receive self-paid vaccine doses must pay for the registration, diagnostic, and injection fees charged by the hospital for their vaccination; however, the cost of the vaccine itself will be waived.'    https://archive.vn/E0yjR

Taiwan 'announced that the government-funded COVID-19 vaccine would be available to ... essential personnel who maintain the normal functions of society such as police and military police officers, and staff and people receiving care at long-term care institutions, social welfare institutions and in the social welfare system on April 23, 2021.'  This means group [C], the elder groups, also started to receive vaccines.    https://archive.vn/aMuaN

'The Central Epidemic Command Center [of Taiwan] announced that beginning May 3, the government-funded COVID-19 vaccine would be available to people living with healthcare personnel, disease prevention and control staff at the central and local governments and front-line workers at high risk of exposure, who are individuals in the first, second and third priority groups. Furthermore, considering that non-medical personnel at clinics and other medical institutions (including pharmacies, blood donation institutions, pathology centers and medical laboratories) who were not included in the first priority groups are also at high risk of infection, such personnel and people living with them will also be eligible for the government-funded vaccine starting May 3, 2021.'  Therefore, beyond three groups but not yet [broad availability].    https://archive.vn/876oS

'The Central Epidemic Command Center announced it would implement an unpaid vaccination leave policy, effective on May 5, 2021. The policy allows workers or civil servants to take a vaccination leave, starting from the date of vaccination until 24:00 on the following day, to receive vaccinations and if they experience adverse reactions after vaccination. An individual can apply to take such leave by providing his or her COVID-19 vaccination record card, and a certificate of diagnosis or any other certificate is not required.'    https://archive.vn/aWqM3

'COVID-19 vaccine available to members of armed forces and people aged 65 and above to build herd immunity starting May 10, 2021' in Taiwan.  Still, beyond three groups but not yet [broad availability].    https://archive.vn/u1Hg6

'The Central News Agency [of Taiwan] said [on 30 May 2021] the government had on Friday [28 May 2021] signed deals with Medigen Vaccine Biologics Corp and United Biomedical Inc for five million doses each, and had oral agreements for another five million each, for a total of 20 million shots.  Medigen confirmed the details in a statement to the stock exchange while the government’s central epidemic command centre said it would issue a statement later. United Biomedical did not immediately respond to a request for comment.  However, neither shot has yet been formally approved for use and both are still undergoing tests, which Taiwan’s government says are going well.' Meanwhile, 'On July 11, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that people aged 50 or older and individuals aged 18 or older who are in the ninth priority group in Taiwan can register their willingness to be vaccinated on the COVID-19 government-funded vaccination appointment reservation system starting today. Details about registration for vaccination appointments are listed below.  1.The two groups of people can begin registering their willingness to be vaccinated from today to 17:00 on July 12, and the number of people registering for vaccination appointments at the first round of registration will be calculated at 17:00 on July 12.  2.Only people who receive text messages between July 13 and July 15 can make vaccination appointments.  3.Eligible individuals will get vaccinated as early as on July 16.  4.The available brand of vaccine for vaccinations in the following three weeks is the AstraZeneca vaccine.'    https://archive.vn/9abyn

'On July 12, the Central Epidemic Command Center pointed out that to increase the first-dose coverage rate among the Taiwanese public, to achieve herd immunity and to meet the needs of the vaccine policy, the interval between the first dose and second dose of the Moderna COVID-19 vaccine at this phase will be adjusted for some groups of people starting today according to the resolutions adopted in the fourth extraordinary meeting of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) at the Ministry of Health and Welfare held on July 11. According to the resolutions, the period between two doses of the Moderna vaccine will remain to be at least 28 days for pregnant women, individuals in the first priority group and crew members of Taiwanese airlines, whereas, starting today, the interval between the two shots of the vaccine for members of the public who are not the above-mentioned three groups of people will be extended to 10-12 weeks. The policy will be adjusted on a rolling basis based on vaccine supply.'    https://archive.vn/LTYgm

'On July 13, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that the third round of registration for vaccination appointments on the COVID-19 vaccination registration and appointment reservation system (https://1922.gov.tw/) started today for people aged 18 or older to register their willingness to be vaccinated. Details about registration for vaccination appointments are listed below.  1. People aged 18 or older can begin registering their willingness to be vaccinated from July 13 to 17:00 on July 15, and the number of people registering for vaccination appointments in the third round of registration will be calculated at 17:00 on July 15.  2. Text messages will be sent to eligible individuals between July 16 and July 18 to notify them to book vaccination appointments. Only those who receive text messages can make an appointment. The available brand of vaccine for vaccinations in this round of registration is the AstraZeneca vaccine.  3. To help people who have difficulty using the COVID-19 vaccination registration and appointment reservation system to register their willingness to get vaccinated, local governments are asked to set up a service hotline or designate staff in order to provide assistance to such people.    The CECC further pointed out that the second round of registration ended at 17:00 on July 12. The system will send text messages to eligible individuals starting the morning of July 13, notifying them to make vaccination appointments. Vaccine will be administered to eligible individuals between July 16 and July 22.'    https://archive.vn/Rp0ob

'On July 15, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that starting July 16, vaccine will be administered to eligible individuals who completed registration and made a vaccination appointment on the COVID-19 vaccination registration and appointment reservation system in the second round of registration for vaccination. Those eligible individuals shall bring their National Health Insurance (NHI) Card to get vaccinated; those who made an appointment to receive their second dose should arrive at the scheduled vaccination site on time for their appointment and present their NHI Card and COVID-19 Vaccination Record before being vaccinated.    The CECC pointed out that the number of people registering their willingness to be vaccinated in the third round of registration was originally scheduled to be counted at 5pm on July 15, and the third round of registration will now be extended until 12pm on July 19 with the number of people registering in this round being counted when the registration closes. Starting July 20, people eligible for making a vaccination appointment will begin to receive a text message informing them to schedule an appointment. The available brand of vaccine for vaccinations in this round of registration is the AstraZeneca vaccine.'    https://archive.vn/0FtGN

'On July 18, the Central Epidemic Command Center (CECC) announced that based on statistics, individuals in the top three priority groups and pregnant women, who received their first dose of the Moderna vaccine between June 9 and July 9, can receive their second dose of the vaccine before August 6 (a minimum 28-day interval between the two doses) to ensure effective use of vaccine.    Additionally, the CECC reminds members of the public who received their first shot of the AstraZeneca vaccine between May 11 and May 23 that a 10-week interval between the two doses of the vaccine will be reached for them starting the next week and that those individuals can register their willingness to receive their second shot on the COVID-19 vaccination registration and appointment reservation system or they can make an appointment at a healthcare facility contracted for COVID-19 vaccinations.'    https://archive.vn/16icg

Vaccines available: AstraZeneca    Uganda is part of the global COVAX initiative and has received a first round of Astra-Zeneca vaccine  as well as two donated allotments of Astra-Zeneca vaccine. Among the priority groups are people who are most vulnerable to COVID-19 or on whom the country`s life, provision of assistance to citizens and their protection depend. For the most part, these groups include those who interact with a large number of people, health care workers, and anyone at risk of serious complications. No availability, but an update on vaccination program:    The President of the Republic, Luis Lacalle Pou, reported that the first phase of the vaccination plan against COVID-19 will begin on March 1. On Friday 26, 192,000 doses of vaccines will arrive from the Sinovac laboratory for vaccinators, education workers, police, firefighters, military personnel and active INAU workers. 1,558,000 doses of Sinovac and weekly deliveries from Pfizer will arrive on March 15.  Accompanied by the Secretary of the Presidency, Álvaro Delgado, and the Minister of Public Health, Daniel Salinas, the president reported that 192,000 doses of the vaccines from the Sinovac laboratory will be received on Friday 26.  In March, as announced by President Lacalle Pou, Sinovac will complete the delivery of 1,558,000 doses, which will arrive on the 15th of that month. For its part, the Pfizer BioNTech laboratory will transfer 468,000 doses between March 8 and April 26. These vaccines will be inoculated to health personnel and older adults residing in institutions.  Once the priority groups have been covered, the vaccination plan will continue with the rest of the adults, the oldest first, until reaching the 18-year-olds.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210223003128/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/uruguay-contara-2-millones-dosis-vacunas-contra-covid-19-marzo

Vaccines still not available, but update regarding vaccination launch:    Next Monday, March 1, the first stage of the Vaccination Plan against Covid-19 begins.  it was determined that the priority group with which vaccination would begin would be made up of education workers, the INAU, police, military, firefighters and customs officials from the first line of control (airports, ports and dry borders). All provided that they are actively working and that they are under 60 years of age.  The first vaccine to arrive in our country on Thursday, February 25, was SINOVAC.  At the time of vaccination, the person will be asked to sign an agreement that indicates, on the one hand, that the vaccine they receive is free and not mandatory, on the other hand, that in the event of any claim to both the laboratory and the State, it must be made under the national jurisdiction. An electronic record of the vaccination will also be made, which will remain in the Vaccination Information System and may be requested from the health provider.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412161744/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/comienza-primera-etapa-del-plan-vacunacion-contra-covid-19

A (SinoVac):  All people under the age of 60 who actively perform tasks as education workers (which includes all pre-school, CAIF, primary, secondary and UTU areas), police, firefighters, INAU workers, military and customs officials of the first line of Control (airports, ports and dry borders). https://web.archive.org/web/20210412162716/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/apertura-agenda-vacunacion-covid-19  Uruguay, the last country in South America to receive delivery of coronavirus vaccines, started its inoculation campaign Monday with a focus on teachers, soldiers, police and firefighters. Some 90 vaccination centers countrywide opened their doors to give a first dose of the Chinese CoronaVac shot to some 140,000 essential workers. https://archive.vn/iDGnj

A (Sinovac):  All people who are qualified and expected to administer the Coronavac vaccine from the Sinovac Laboratory: firefighters, police, education workers and INAU, military (all active and under 60 years old), people on chronic dialysis, pre-transplant list and between the ages of 55 and 59, can be scheduled until today at 5:00 p.m. After this deadline, essential workers (firefighters, police, military, education workers and INAU) must be vaccinated according to the age group to which they belong. For people on chronic dialysis, the pre-transplant list and the 55 to 59 age group, the agenda will be opened again in a future instance that will be communicated in due course.  Then, starting at 6:00 p.m., as reported yesterday, health workers in priority areas will be able to schedule themselves to receive the first dose of the Pfizer/Biontech vaccine (expected to start vaccinations on March 12th): CTI, CTI Support Services, Out-of-hospital care, Emergency and Urgency Doors, Hospital stay, Surgical block, Swabs.  Note that although people on chronic dialysis, pre-transplant list and between the ages of 55 and 59 were eligible to receive Sinovac in the first round of vaccinations. However, this is a very specific population, therefore, this has still been coded as a 1G.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210314144815/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/agenda-vacunacion

A and B: Health workers, persons deprived of liberty, and detention centre personnel.    On the night of Wednesday, March 10, the first 50,000 doses of the Covid-19 vaccine from the Pfizer / BioNTech laboratory arrived in Uruguay on a cargo flight of the German airline Lufthansa.  On Friday, March 12, at 8:00 a.m. The vaccination of people who perform tasks in the prioritized health areas began: swabs, care personnel at emergency and emergency doors, out-of-hospital care personnel, hospital admission, surgical block, ITC support service and ITC staff. Then it will be extended to the rest of the health personnel who, being very exposed to contracting and spreading the virus, was one of the first groups called to be vaccinated against Covid-19.    Additionally, people deprived of liberty and the personnel of detention facilities began getting vaccinated (starting with women's facilities and INISA).    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412165657/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/comenzo-inmunizacion-del-personal-salud  https://web.archive.org/web/20210322084002/https://www.gub.uy/ministerio-salud-publica/comunicacion/noticias/comunicado-sobre-plan-vacunacion-contra-covid-19

Most states are allowing vaccination of key workers (A), clinically vulnerable groups/those with high-risk medical conditions (B), and elderly groups (C). Some states have also begun vaccination of broad age groups.     However, as of 23 March 2021, Maine is only vaccinating key workers (PreK-12 teachers, school staff, etc) and elderly groups (age 50+). The state plans to expand vaccine eligibility to ages 16+ on 19 April 2021.   According to the Maine COVID-19 vaccine FAQ webpage:  "Maine is using an age-based approach to vaccination eligibility that reflect?scientific?data?indicating?that age is?among the strongest predictors of?whether an individual is likely to?get seriously ill and?die?from?COVID-19, even more so than risk factors?such as?underlying medical conditions."     Code remains 2G.    Currently, the Pfizer-BioNTech, Moderna, and J&J/Janssen vaccines are available in the US. About 25 million people have been fully vaccinated with the Pfizer vaccine, about 22 million with the Moderna vaccine, and 3 million with the J&J/Janssen vaccine.    Link to the Maine COVID-19 vaccine FAQ:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210328022528/https://www.maine.gov/covid19/vaccines/public-faq    Link to CDC COVID-19 vaccination dashboard:  https://archive.vn/LX1ZU

As of 25 March 2021, the CDC announced a program to provide COVID-19 vaccinations at dialysis centers to patients with chronic kidney disease and healthcare workers in that setting.    Link to CDC news release:  https://web.archive.org/web/20210327213240/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/s0325-vaccines-dialysis-centers.html

As of March 30, it appears that all states have expanded eligibility for vaccination to at least 3 groups. For example, as of March 22, all clinically vulnerable groups (age 16+) are now eligible for a vaccine in Wisconsin (Pfizer, Moderna, Johnson & Johnson vaccines are all in use). All Arkansans age 16 or older are now eligible to receive the vaccine. Starting March 30th, Minnesotans over the age of 15 can receive vaccines.     A report published on March 29 states that a "CDC study provides strong evidence that mRNA COVID-19 vaccines are highly effective in preventing SARS-CoV-2 infections in real-world conditions among health care personnel, first responders, and other essential workers.  These groups are more likely than the general population to be exposed to the virus because of their occupations." For more information on the study, see this archived link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210414011134/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/p0329-COVID-19-Vaccines.html    https://archive.fo/fvFSA     link: https://web.archive.org/web/20210405211600/https://www.healthy.arkansas.gov/programs-services/topics/covid-19-vaccination-plan    https://web.archive.org/web/20210322212232/https://www.wbay.com/2021/03/16/wisconsin-pushes-up-medical-condition-covid-19-vaccine-eligibility-to-march-22/

A press release from April 6 states that the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) has awarded funding to support local efforts to increase vaccine uptake by expanding COVID-19 vaccine programs and ensuring greater equity and access to vaccine by those disproportionately affected by SARS-CoV-2...  "The awards are part of $3 billion in funding that CDC has granted to 64 jurisdictions to bolster broad-based vaccine distribution, access, and administration efforts. The funding was made available by the American Rescue Plan and the Coronavirus Response and Relief Supplemental Appropriations Act and will provide critical support through CDC’s existing immunization cooperative agreements in communities around the country."    Nearly 80 percent of Pre-K-12 teachers, school staff, and childcare workers received at least their first shot of COVID-19 vaccine by the end of March, according to the CDC’s latest estimates. Based on state-level coding within this dataset, all states are providing vaccinations to at least 3 groups at this time, and many are expanding eligibility to anyone 16 years old or older.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210414010026/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/p0407-covid-19-vaccine-programs.html    https://web.archive.org/web/20210414010259/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/s0406-teachers-staff-vaccine.html

On April 13 the CDC and FDA released a joint statement on the Johnson & Johnson (Janssen) vaccine, which is reported to have caused blood clots in six  individuals who received the Janssen COVID-19 Vaccine. The statement says that as of April 12, more than 6.8 million doses of the Johnson & Johnson (Janssen ) vaccine have been administered in the U.S.     "CDC will convene a meeting of the Advisory Committee on Immunization Practices (ACIP) on Wednesday to further review these cases and assess their potential significance. FDA will review that analysis as it also investigates these cases. Until that process is complete, we are recommending a pause in the use of this vaccine out of an abundance of caution. This is important, in part, to ensure that the health care provider community is aware of the potential for these adverse events and can plan for proper recognition and management due to the unique treatment required with this type of blood clot."    Given this news, it is likely that states will pause the use of the Johnson & Johnson vaccine and will continue to use Pfizer and Moderna vaccines; this may delay timelines for vaccine eligibility to wider groups of people.     https://web.archive.org/web/20210414011900/https://www.cdc.gov/media/releases/2021/s0413-JJ-vaccine.html

Vaccines: Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  Uzbekistan government have approved vaccines and started vaccinations as of April 1st according to latest update. The first shipment of AstraZeneca vaccine have been received on March 17th with the aim to provide initial doses to individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel as per the update,  "Has the government of Uzbekistan approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? Yes  Are vaccines available in Uzbekistan for U. S. citizens to receive?  Yes, although supplies are still very limited.  Which vaccines are available in Uzbekistan?  Vaxzevria (also known as Astra Zeneca) and the Uzbek-Chinese vaccine ZF-UZ-VAC2001  According to Uzbek health authorities, the government’s initial vaccination campaign against COVID-19 began on April 1 with the first residents of Tashkent and regional capitals getting their shots.  The Health Ministry said on Telegram that people in district capitals and smaller settlements will start getting vaccinated on May 1, while vaccine doses will arrive in more remote areas in June.  The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used.  The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, schoolteachers and kindergarten teachers, and law enforcement and military personnel."    Archived article   http://web.archive.org/web/20210409031018/https://uz.usembassy.gov/covid-19-information/  ______________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    A latest update also reported that the government started mass vaccination as per news, "An official statement says that "3,138 vaccination centers and 862 mobile medical brigades have been set up across the country for the vaccination campaign...[and] more than 4,000 doctors and more than 11,000 nurses are involved in the vaccination program."    Also, "The ministry said the British-Swedish Vaxzevria (formerly known as AstraZeneca) and the Chinese-Uzbek ZF-UZ-VAC 2001 vaccines are initially being used to guard against COVID-19 among the country's 32 million people.    The initial rollout is for individuals older than 65, medical personnel, people with chronic diseases, teachers of schools and kindergartens, and law enforcement and military personnel."  Archived Link   http://web.archive.org/web/20210410190425/https://www.rferl.org/a/uzbekistan-mass-vaccination-covid-19/31181553.html  _________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________    As per update, these vaccinations are conducted free of charge as per news, "Vaccination plan has been developed for the immunization of the country’s population, according to which 4.1 million people will be vaccinated in the first stage: people over 65 years old, medical workers, people with chronic diseases, teachers, kindergarten employees, law enforcement agencies. They will be vaccinated in state institutions and free of charge."    Archived Link  http://web.archive.org/web/20210411215518/https://www.asinta.com/news/uzbekistan-covid-19-employer-resources/

Has the government of Vietnam approved a COVID-19 vaccine for use? [Yes]  Vietnam has approved the COVID-19 vaccine developed by AstraZeneca and the University of Oxford for use in urgent situations.  According to Vietnam’s Ministry of Health, it is expected that the Oxford- Astra Zeneca vaccine will be available in the first quarter of 2021.

"Vietnam would receive around five million Covid-19 vaccine doses by the end of February, Deputy Health Minister Truong Quoc Cuong said at a meeting Tuesday.  They include about 4.9 million vaccine doses provided via Covax. About 117,000 other doses would be imported... by the end of February.    With the vaccine doses, five million people will receive the first shots, and three months later the second shots would be administered. Around two to five million people on the frontline of the coronavirus fight would be prioritized to get the vaccine."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210215195049/https://vietreader.com/news/33728-vietnam-to-receive-five-million-covid-19-vaccine-doses-within-this-month.html

"Vietnam's government said on Tuesday health workers, diplomats and military personnel would be among the first to be vaccinated against COVID-19 when the country starts its inoculation programme next month.  ...  In the first quarter of 2021, Vietnam aims to inoculate 500,000 medical staff and 116,000 others directly involved in the fight against the pandemic, the government said in a statement.  ...  In the second quarter, Vietnam plans to vaccinate 1.8 million more people, including 9,200 customs officials, 4,080 diplomats, 1.03 million military personnel, 304,000 police officers and 550,000 teachers, the government said."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210301063117/https://www.msn.com/en-au/lifestyle/wellbeing/vietnam-details-priorities-for-first-phase-of-covid-19-vaccinations/ar-BB1dVeLA?oci_d=mailsignout

Ho Chi Minh City, Gia Lai, Long An, Da Nang, Hoa Binh and Khanh Hoa. A (AstraZeneca): Frontline health workers continue to be vaccinated. These include medical staff and staff directly treating patients with COVID-19, medical staff performing tasks such as sampling, testing, tracing, members of the COVID-19 plus groups. and the Steering Committee for epidemic prevention in localities.  On April 1, COVAX's first batch of 811,200 doses arrived in Vietnam. A total of 4.1 million doses of vaccine expected to be available in Vietnam by the end of May 2021. Vietnam will reach the target of providing vaccines to 20% of the population by the end of 2021  As of April 12, the total number of vaccinated individuals is 58,418.    On April 6, the Ministry of Health has issued a document to expedite 63 provinces and cities to make a list of 10 priority groups for COVID-19 vaccination.  1. The front-line forces of anti-epidemic prevention include:  - People working in medical establishments.  - Participants in epidemic prevention (members of the Steering Committee for epidemic prevention and control at all levels, people working in isolated areas, in charge of tracking, epidemiological investigation, community-based COVID team, volunteers , reporter...).  - Military force (local forces involved in epidemic prevention).  - Police force (local forces involved in epidemic prevention).  2. Vietnamese diplomatic staff and officers and their relatives sent for term work; officials directly participated in welcoming Government delegations and welcoming Vietnamese from abroad; Diplomatic Corps and UN system organizations in Vietnam.  3. Customs staff, immigration officer.  4. Essential service providers: aviation, transport, and tourism; providing electricity and water services ...  5. Teachers, people working at educational and training establishments; People working at agencies and administrative units often contact with many people.  6. People with chronic diseases.  7. People over 65 years old.  8. People living in epidemic areas.  9. The poor, social policy beneficiaries.  10. Persons sent by competent state agencies to work abroad, study or work abroad.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210412231904/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/en/web/guest/-/6847426-2316  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412232651/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/en/web/guest/-/6847426-2320  https://web.archive.org/web/20210412232219/https://ncov.moh.gov.vn/en/web/guest/-/6847426-2293

More than 46,000 people (healthcare and frontline workers) have been inoculated against the pandemic in Vietnam since Vietnam’s vaccination program began on March 8.  - Vietnam on June 12 approved the emergency use of the Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine.  Vietnam, which has previously approved the AstraZeneca vaccine, Russia's Sputnik V and China's Sinopharm vaccine, said it is seeking to procure 31 million doses of the Pfizer-BioNTech version for delivery in the next quarter.  - Vietnam approved a COVID-19 vaccine by China’s Sinopharm for emergency use as per the Ministry of Health.- June 4.   - Vietnam received the fourth batch of the Oxford-AstraZeneca vaccine with 288,000 doses arriving in Ho Chi Minh City on May 25.     The Vietnamese government is vaccinating only individuals in defined priority groups, including healthcare workers, staff working at quarantine sites, Vietnamese diplomats and immigration officers, essential service workers, senior citizens over 65 with chronic diseases, residents in outbreak areas, etc.    http://web.archive.org/web/20210614211239/https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/covid-19-vietnam-approves-pfizer-biontech-vaccine-emergency-use-15001520  https://archive.vn/pVYlZ  http://web.archive.org/web/20210602075309/https://vn.usembassy.gov/u-s-citizen-services/covid-19-information/

New vaccination plan is rolled out on 9 July. But considering the limited doses, the target groups should not be all covered. So this remains to be 3G until further solid evidence.    "The Ministry of Health has rolled out a COVID-19 vaccination plan for the 2021-2022 period with an overall goal of reaching herd immunity by the end of 2021 or early 2022.  The vaccination rate among people aged 18 and above is expected to increase to at least 50% this year and over 70% by the end of the first quarter of 2022, according to the plan.  The plan also specifies 16 priority groups for vaccination as follows:      1. Medical workers      2. Those who participate in COVID-19 prevention and control work (members of steering committees on COVID-19 prevention and control, staff working in quarantine camps, volunteers, reporters)      3. Military personnel      4. Police force      5. Vietnamese diplomats and their relatives; people working in diplomatic missions and international organizations in Viet Nam       6. Customs and immigration officers      7. Those working to maintain the supply of essential services such as aviation, transportation, tourism, electricity and water supply      8. Teachers, students, young doctors, people working in agencies and administrative units, law, notaries and auctioneers organizations who frequently contact with many people      9. People with chronic diseases, people aged 65      10. Residents in pandemic-hit areas      11. Poor people and social policy beneficiaries      12. People who are sent by a competent authority to study or work abroad or others who wish to go abroad to study or work, and foreign experts working in Viet Nam      13. Factory workers and their relatives      14. Religious dignitaries      15. Freelance workers      16. Other subjects decided by the Minister of Health and Chairpersons of provincial/municipal People's Committees or proposed by vaccine donors.    The plan will be implemented nationwide from July 2021 to April 2022, with priority to be given to:      - Pandemic-hit provinces and cities      - Localities in key economic regions       - Industrial and populous localities      - Border localities with international order gates."    link: https://archive.ph/JcRCf

Up until 18 July 2021, there were 23,995 COVID-19 doses administered in Vanuatu. From 21 June 2021, COVID-19 vaccination was broadly opened to all adults 18 years old and over, with a continued focus on priority groups including health workers and front line workers (e.g. border workers, quarantine facility staff, public transport drivers), the elderly (55 and over), and people 35 and over with known underlying medical conditions. The current target area is the population of Efate and offshore islands. So far, a total of 23,881 people received at least one dose of AstraZeneca or Sinopharm, including 629 healthcare workers, 1,200 other frontline workers, 4,671 elderly persons and 3,432 persons with known underlying conditions. 114 people have received two doses of Sinopharm and are considered fully vaccinated.     Vaccines administered: Sinopharm, AstraZeneca Vaccine    https://web.archive.org/web/20210724122438/https://covid19.gov.vu/index.php/vaccination/information  Situation Report 44 (Inclusive of vaccination data up until till 18th July): https://web.archive.org/web/20210724122803/https://covid19.gov.vu/images/Situation-reports/Vanuatu_COVID19_NHEOC_SitRep_44__.pdf

https://archive.ph/zIUF0   Health Minister Jonas Chanda says Government is finalising the detailed modalities of the choices of vaccines to be used and the operationalisation of the programme to be approved by Cabinet soon in the coming days.

A,B,C   She says cabinet has approved that the vaccine will priorities people above the age of 65, including those with chronic illnesses as they are at high risk of death.  Ms. Siliya says others that will be prioritized include health frontline workers, police, security traditional leaders, clergy and immigration officers as these are taken as the most essential to maintaining core societal functions.  She says marketeers, traders including bus and truck drivers involved in cross-border business, will also be prioritized in view of the environment they work through.  https://archive.vn/0G4Rx#selection-1057.0-1065.166

Ministry of Health Permanent Secretary for Technical Services Kennedy Malama says government will only cover 20 percent of the 8.4 million citizens who are eligible to receive the COVID-19 vaccines in the country.  Lusaka that 13 vaccines that have been proven to be effective will be available, noting that only COVAX and astrazeneca will be administered to citizens by government.  The Permanent Secretary stated that other approved vaccines out of the 13 will be administered to citizens through private partners that have shown interest.

A:  AstraZeneca  Zambia received the first doses of the vaccine on April 12. Vaccine roll-out began on April 14. Health care workers will be the first group to receive the vaccine.  "Government has resolved that the COVID - 19 Vaccination Programme will be implemented in a cautious and phased up manner, and on a pilot and voluntary basis,"  We will begin with our frontline health care workers, in both public and private health facilities. I am, therefore, very delighted to join our gallant health care workers here at the University Teaching Hospitals as we kick-start this roll-out today. Other frontline workers performing core societal functions including, but not limited to, the police, defense and security personnel, immigration officers, teachers, judiciary staff, traditional leaders, the clergy and the media will follow, "" Dr Chanda said."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419031607/https://reliefweb.int/report/zambia/zambia-launches-covid-19-vaccination    https://web.archive.org/web/20210419031410/https://www.facebook.com/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.facebook.com%2Fmohzambia%2Fposts%2F1884192308422084

""a cumulative 45,740 persons have been vaccinated against COVID-19 since 14th April 2021 when launched. May 15: ""Ladies and Gentlemen, in the last 24 hours, we administered an additional 7,417 doses of the AstraZeneca vaccine, bringing the cumulative number of vaccinated persons to 107,790 (of which 102,268 are AstraZeneca and 5,522 are Sinopharm doses administered).
